item.title: Brittany add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Brittany add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Jane Eyre "I desired more...than was within my reach. Who blames me? Many call me discontented. I couldn't help it: the restlessness is in my nature; it agitated me to pain sometimes." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Brittany add a quote by C. JoyBell C.
item.description: "Last night I lost the world, and gained the universe." -- C. JoyBell C.

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Tony Schwartz
item.description: "Let go of certainty. The opposite isn't uncertainty. It's openness, curiosity and a willingness to embrace paradox, rather than choose up sides. The ultimate challenge is to accept ourselves exactly as we are, but never stop trying to learn and grow." -- Tony Schwartz

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There are times in life when people must know when not to let go. Balloons are designed to teach small children this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Jeffrey McDaniel
item.description: "I realise there's something incredibly honest about trees in winter, how they're experts at letting things go." -- Jeffrey McDaniel

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Kim Sowol
item.description: "When you leave, weary of me, without a word I shall gently let you go." -- Kim Sowol

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "For how imperiously, how coolly, in disregard of all one’s feelings, does the hard, cold, uninteresting course of daily realities move on! Still we must eat, and drink, and sleep, and wake again, - still bargain, buy, sell, ask and answer questions, - pursue, in short, a thousand shadows, though all interest in them be over; the cold, mechanical habit of living remaining, after all vital interest in it has fled." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Osayi Osar-Emokpae
item.description: "Quitting is not giving up, it's choosing to focus your attention on something more important. Quitting is not losing confidence, it's realizing that there are more valuable ways you can spend your time. Quitting is not making excuses, it's learning to be more productive, efficient and effective instead. Quitting is letting go of things (or people) that are sucking the life out of you so you can do more things that will bring you strength." -- Osayi Osar-Emokpae

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Melody Beattie
item.description:
"Make New Year's goals. Dig within, and discover what you would like to have happen in your life this year. This helps you do your part. It is an affirmation that you're interested in fully living life in the year to come.
Goals give us direction. They put a powerful force into play on a universal, conscious, and subconscious level. Goals give our life direction.
What would you like to have happen in your life this year? What would you like to do, to accomplish? What good would you like to attract into your life? What particular areas of growth would you like to have happen to you? What blocks, or character defects, would you like to have removed?
What would you like to attain? Little things and big things? Where would you like to go? What would you like to have happen in friendship and love? What would you like to have happen in your family life?
What problems would you like to see solved? What decisions would you like to make? What would you like to happen in your career?
Write it down. Take a piece of paper, a few hours of your time, and write it all down - as an affirmation of you, your life, and your ability to choose. Then let it go.
The new year stands before us, like a chapter in a book, waiting to be written. We can help write that story by setting goals." -- Melody Beattie

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "The art is not one of forgetting but letting go. And when everything else is gone, you can be rich in loss." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Papaji
item.description: "Whatever comes, let it come, what stays let stay, what goes let go." -- Papaji

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Charlotte Eriksson
item.description: "I am not a broken heart. I am not collarbones or drunken letters never sent. I am not the way I leave or left or didn’t know how to handle anything, at any time, and I am not your fault." -- Charlotte Eriksson

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Samuel L. Drew
item.description: "You don't live in the past; you take a sledgehammer to it to see what stands so that you can build on it." -- Samuel L. Drew

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "Trust is earned, respect is given, and loyalty is demonstrated. Betrayal of any one of those is to lose all three." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Ziad K. Abdelnour
item.description: "One of the hardest decisions you'll ever face in life is choosing whether to walk away or try harder." -- Ziad K. Abdelnour
